intro: Gomphandra donnaiensis, commonly known as the Philippine gomphandra, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. It has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a leathery texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
